intro: Pentacalia comarapensis, commonly known as the Comarapense pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of blue or violet. The plant is perennial and thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
